titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George H. Bissell Papers
titlestmt.author: by Lisa Conathan

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:22

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The papers consist of printed material, business records, and photographs that document the Bissell family and the foundations of the American petroleum industry in the 1850s. The collection is bound in seven volumes: two volumes of printed material relating to petroleum and other industries, three volumes of records of the Pennsylvania Rock Oil Company and the Adirondack Pulp Mills that document the creation and early growth of the companies, and two Bissell family photograph albums.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from William Reese Co. on the Chandler White and Philena Pennell Smith Acquisitions Fund and the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2008.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The George H. Bissell Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: George H. Bissell Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

bioghist.head: George H. Bissell, 1821-1884
bioghist.p: George H. Bissell was co-founder of the Pennsylvania Rock Oil Company, the first petroleum company in the United States, and of the Adirondack Pulp Mills, among many other business ventures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of printed material, business records, and photographs that document the Bissell family and the foundations of the American petroleum industry in the 1850s. The collection is bound in seven volumes: two volumes of printed material relating to petroleum and other industries, three volumes of records of the Pennsylvania Rock Oil Company and the Adirondack Pulp Mills that document the creation and early growth of the companies, and two Bissell family photograph albums.
Printed material in this collection is described in Orbis (Yale's online catalog) and the catalog records can be reviewed by searching for GEN MSS 788 in Call Number (Local).

did.unittitle: Sammelband volume of pamphlets relating to petroleum and other industries

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes prospectuses relating to silver mining in Nevada, a marble quarry in Milford, Connecticut, a salt mine in Louisiana, and iron and timber in Pennsylvania.

unittitle.title: Sketches of Representative Men, North and South
